sentences: Mu jalaga see kiri pidev peale.
Ta torkas oma s천bra jalaga laualt 채ra m천ne asja.
context: 'jalaga' in Estonian is primarily used to denote using or with a foot. It can be part of phrases indicating movement by walking, or actions involving the foot. Commonly seen in both literal contexts such as 'walking on foot,' and figurative or specific instructions.
